meanings.definition: The state of being scatterbrained or easily distracted.
meanings.sent1: Her ditsiness often led her to forget important appointments.
meanings.sent2: His ditsiness in class made it hard for him to focus on his studies.
meanings.sent3: Despite her ditsiness, she always managed to find humor in her forgetfulness.
meanings.sent4: The ditsiness of the puppy was endearing as it chased its tail in circles.
meanings.sent5: The ditsiness of the old man was evident as he searched for his glasses on his head.

meanings.definition: A tendency to act in a silly or frivolous manner.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's ditsiness on stage always made the audience laugh.
meanings.sent2: Her ditsiness at the party brought a light-hearted atmosphere to the room.
meanings.sent3: His ditsiness during the game of charades caused everyone to guess the wrong answer.
meanings.sent4: The ditsiness of the children playing in the park was contagious to all who watched.
meanings.sent5: The ditsiness of the clown entertained the children at the birthday party.
